alert.note: Alert for Tusas Mountains Including Chama (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 11 at 11:38AM MST until March 11 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulation 1 to 3 inches, except 3 to 8 inches above 8,000 feet. Southwest and west winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Tusas Mountains Including Chama. * WHEN...Until 6 PM MST this evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Some roads may be closed, especially U.S. Highway 64 between Tres Piedras and Tierra Amarilla. The combination of heavy snow and blowing snow may lead to periods of very low visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heavy wet snow with this event may break tree limbs and down power lines.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.
